result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J. Johnson

records.addlTxt:
8:58 AM Defendant Kyle J. Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Kyle J. Johnson.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court reviews competency report.
Atty Hansen heard - has reviewed with Deft.
ADA heard - has reviewed report.
Court heard on report.
Dr. finds deft is not competent to stand trial and not likely to regain competency.
Atty Hansen heard and stipulates to the findings in the report.
ADA heard and agrees.
Court accepts the report of the Dr. and finds the Deft is not competent to proceed, and also not likely to regain competency.
Court heard - there is no placement available for the Deft anywhere in the state.
A rep from DHHS is present and is heard on attempts made for placement for the Deft, even outside of the State of Wisconsin.
Court heard.
ADA heard on statute - Deft is to be released from custody today, if found not competent.
Atty Hansen heard.
Court heard on Deft's current JIPS order.
Court speaks to Deft's Grandmother who is present in the courtroom.
DHHS reps are heard.
Deft's Grandmother is heard.
All those present are heard - every possible avenue that anyone could think of has been looked into and no placement options have been found.
Court heard and orders the Deft be released forthwith.
Deft to be released to the Grandmother.
Grandmother heard and can not get there to pick up Deft until sometime later today.
Bob is present in the jail video room and is heard - will hold the Deft until the Grandmother arrives.
Court requests a deputy stay at the Grandmother's home with the Deft until other placement can be found.
ADA moves for the case to be dismissed.
Atty Hansen heard and has no objections.
Court dismisses the case.
9:42 AM

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Order for Competency Examination by DHS
Fax machine no working - personally brought to sheriff's department

2:52 PM Defendant Kyle J. Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Spansail with defendant at the jail
Copy of Complaint - Court reviews penalties and charges
Atty Spansail is being heard
ADA is being heard on bond
Atty Spansail is being heard
Court questions defendant Competency.  Wants defendant to be evaluated.
Atty Brad Hansen is being heard - def has already been found not competent and not convicted in another case. (22CF149)
ADA is being heard
Court sets $2000.00 cash bail - Sign waiver of extradition.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  No contact with victim.
Court wants to know why Corp Co did not file a chapter 51.
03:03 PM
Competency hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
